verses.kjv: The elder unto the wellbeloved Gaius, whom I love in the truth.
verses.web: The elder to Gaius the beloved, whom I love in truth.
verses.ct: From the elder, to my dear friend Gaius, whom I love in the truth.

verses.kjv: Beloved, I wish above all things that thou mayest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.
verses.web: Beloved, I pray that you may prosper in all things and be healthy, even as your soul prospers.
verses.ct: Dear friend, I pray that everything goes well for you and that you are in good health, just as your soul is doing well.

verses.kjv: For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.
verses.web: For I rejoiced greatly when brothers came and testified about your truth, even as you walk in truth.
verses.ct: It brought me tremendous joy when some of the brothers arrived and told me how you are living in the truth — that you are faithfully walking in it.

verses.kjv: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.
verses.web: I have no greater joy than this: to hear about my children walking in truth.
verses.ct: Nothing makes me happier than hearing that my children are walking in the truth.

verses.kjv: Beloved, thou doest faithfully whatsoever thou doest to the brethren, and to strangers;
verses.web: Beloved, you do a faithful work in whatever you accomplish for those who are brothers and strangers.
verses.ct: Dear friend, you are being faithful in everything you do for the brothers, even when they are strangers to you.

verses.kjv: Which have borne witness of thy charity before the church: whom if thou bring forward on their journey after a godly sort, thou shalt do well:
verses.web: They have testified about your love before the assembly. You will do well to send them forward on their journey in a way worthy of God,
verses.ct: They have spoken about your love in front of the church. You would do well to send them on their way in a manner worthy of God.

verses.kjv: Because that for his name’s sake they went forth, taking nothing of the Gentiles.
verses.web: because for the sake of the Name they went out, taking nothing from the Gentiles.
verses.ct: They set out for the sake of the Name and refused to accept any support from the Gentiles.

verses.kjv: We therefore ought to receive such, that we might be fellowhelpers to the truth.
verses.web: We therefore ought to receive such, that we may be fellow workers for the truth.
verses.ct: So we ought to welcome people like them, so that we become fellow workers for the truth.

verses.kjv: I wrote unto the church: but Diotrephes, who loveth to have the preeminence among them, receiveth us not.
verses.web: I wrote to the assembly, but Diotrephes, who loves to be first among them, doesn’t accept what we say.
verses.ct: I wrote a letter to the church, but Diotrephes — who loves being in charge — refuses to listen to us.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, if I come, I will remember his deeds which he doeth, prating against us with malicious words: and not content therewith, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and forbiddeth them that would, and casteth them out of the church.
verses.web: Therefore if I come, I will call attention to his deeds which he does, unjustly accusing us with wicked words. Not content with this, neither does he himself receive the brothers, and those who would, he forbids and throws out of the assembly.
verses.ct: So if I come, I will call out what he's been doing. He spreads malicious lies about us. And that's not all — he refuses to welcome the traveling brothers himself, and when others want to, he stops them and throws them out of the church.

verses.kjv: Beloved, follow not that which is evil, but that which is good. He that doeth good is of God: but he that doeth evil hath not seen God.
verses.web: Beloved, don’t imitate that which is evil, but that which is good. He who does good is of God. He who does evil hasn’t seen God.
verses.ct: Dear friend, don't imitate what is evil — imitate what is good. Whoever does good is from God. Whoever does evil has not seen God.

verses.kjv: Demetrius hath good report of all men, and of the truth itself: yea, and we also bear record; and ye know that our record is true.
verses.web: Demetrius has the testimony of all, and of the truth itself; yes, we also testify, and you know that our testimony is true.
verses.ct: Everyone speaks well of Demetrius, and the truth itself backs him up. We also vouch for him, and you know that our testimony is true.

verses.kjv: I had many things to write, but I will not with ink and pen write unto thee:
verses.web: I had many things to write to you, but I am unwilling to write to you with ink and pen;
verses.ct: I have so much more to say to you, but I'd rather not put it all down with ink and pen.

verses.kjv: But I trust I shall shortly see thee, and we shall speak face to face. Peace be to thee. Our friends salute thee. Greet the friends by name.
verses.web: but I hope to see you soon. Then we will speak face to face. Peace be to you. The friends greet you. Greet the friends by name.
verses.ct: I hope to see you soon, and then we'll talk face to face. Peace be to you. Our friends here send their greetings. Please greet each of our friends there by name.
